benchmark_details.name: OpenCATP
benchmark_details.overview: OpenCATP is the first dataset for cost-aware planning, comprising 11,100 evaluation samples from diverse tasks, allowing for quantitative evaluation of task performance and execution costs through the Quality of Plan (QoP) metric.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation for cost-aware tool planning using large language models.

data.source: OpenCATP dataset created from various tasks based on cost-aware planning requirements.
data.annotation: Manually annotated based on task performance and execution costs.

methodology.calculation: QoP is calculated by combining task performance and execution costs using a weighted formula.
methodology.interpretation: Higher QoP indicates a better balance between performance and costs.
methodology.validation: The evaluation is validated through extensive experimental comparisons with existing methods.
